column4: hi guys, trying to remove my xp safely from my dual boot setup, I did have some help, but I couldn't finish, any change of some help
Add a line containing "GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER=true" to /etc/default/grub then run "sudo update-grub that was my last command to do
ubotto can you help me in removing xp from my dual boot system?
do you have any imp data on xp partition?
then why dont you just go go gparted, umnount xp and delte it and create new partitin there? or you can extend your current linux partition to that free space?
you currently have both xp and ubuntu installed ? right?
sudo echo "GRUB_DISABLE_OS_PROBER=true" >> /etc/default/grub that was a command I was given
as i guess you may only need to update grub or reinstall grub nothing else. its so simple just delete xp from gparted
my mount point is in windows media on gparted.  If I remove it will I still be able to boot up?
i am not sure. i dont konw. you ask someone else.
have you seen the forum link i have given to you?
just for you info that resizing a partition take a looooooooooot time depend on the size of the resizing partition.
